ISSUE.TITLE: WP_REST_Request:get_params()/get_param() returns route...
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Not sure if this was intended, but it's annoying me. In my callback, where `$request` is `WP_REST_Request` object and I do this: ``` $params = $request->get_params(); $zero = $request->get_param( 0 ); ``` I get a 0 index in `$params` and `$zero` has the route URL. I don't see why it should be a param, it's not registered on the endpoint, and its redundant to what I can get with the `get_url_params()` method.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #1601 from WP-API/fix-editable-desc Correct methods in WP_REST_SERVER::EDITABLE description
